activateThriftGroup(uint256).details: Manually activate a thrift group before it reaches max members.      Requires payout order to be set and start date not yet passed.

params.groupId: ID of the group to activate

addMemberToPrivateGroup(uint256,address).details: Add member to private group (admin only)

addRewardToken(address,address).details: Add a reward token to track for a specific asset

addSupportedToken(address).details: Expose token storage functions - Add a new supported token

params.tokenAddress: Address of the token to add

allMembersContributed(uint256).details: Check if all members have contributed for current cycle

returns._0: bool Whether all members have contributed

breakTimelock(address).details: Break timelock and withdraw immediately with penalty

canWithdraw().details: Check if withdrawals are allowed (last week of month)

claimMyRewards(address[]).details: Claim accumulated rewards for the caller

params.assets: List of assets to claim rewards from

convertToShares(address,uint256).details: Convert assets to shares for a token

coverDefault(uint256,address).details: Cover a defaulter's contribution using their collateral

params.contributionAmount: Amount each member must contribute per cycle
params.isPublic: Whether the group is publicly joinable
params.startDate: When the group should start (must be future date)
params.tokenAddress: Address of the token to use for contributions

deposit(address,uint256).details: Deposit any supported ERC20 token into savings and then to Aave

distributePayout(uint256).details: Manually distribute payout once all members have contributed. Can be invoked by the group admin to trigger payout ahead of automatic detection. Reverts if not all members have paid for the cycle.

emergencyWithdraw(uint256).details: Allow group admin to emergency-withdraw their contributed funds before payout processing.      This is primarily a safety valve and is surfaced for the test-suite.      It refunds only the admin's current cycle contribution (if any) and de-activates the group.

executeEmergencyWithdrawal(address).details: Execute emergency withdrawal (only after timelock expires)

getBalance(address,address).details: Gets a user's balance for a specific token

getCurrentRecipient(uint256).details: Get current recipient for a group's payout

returns.contributionAmount: Amount each member must contribute per cycle
returns.isPublic: Whether the group is publicly joinable
returns.memberCount: Number of members in the group
returns.nextPayoutDate: When the next payout is due

getGroupPayouts(uint256).details: Get all payouts for a specific group

returns._0: Array of payouts for the group

getMemberStatus(uint256,address).details: Get member's contribution status for current cycle

returns.hasPaid: Whether member has paid this cycle

returns._0: Array of addresses in payout order

getSupportedTokens().details: Get list of all supported tokens through token storage

getSupportedTokensWithPagination(uint256.details: Get list of all supported tokens with pagination

params.count: Maximum number of tokens to return

getTotalShares(address).details: Get total shares for a token

returns._0: totalShares Total shares for the token

getUserDepositTime(address,address).details: Get user's deposit time for a token

getUserDepositTime_Legacy(address).details: Get user's legacy deposit time (across all tokens)

getUserTotalContributed(address,address).details: Get total contributed by user across all groups for a specific token

params._initialOwner: Address of the initial owner (should be timelock)

isGroupMember(uint256,address).details: Check if an address is a member of a group

returns._0: bool Whether the address is a member

isValidToken(address).details: Check if a token is supported

params.groupId: ID of the group to join

leaveGroup(uint256).details: Leave a thrift group (only before group starts or in emergency)

params.groupId: ID of the group to leave

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

paused().details: Returns true if the contract is paused, and false otherwise.

proxiableUUID().details: Implementation of the ERC-1822 {proxiableUUID} function. This returns the storage slot used by the implementation. It is used to validate the implementation's compatibility when performing an upgrade. IMPORTANT: A proxy pointing at a proxiable contract should not be considered proxiable itself, because this risks bricking a proxy that upgrades to it, by delegating to itself until out of gas. Thus it is critical that this function revert if invoked through a proxy. This is guaranteed by the `notDelegated` modifier.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby disabling any functionality that is only available to the owner.

resumeOperations().details: Resume contract operations after circuit breaker (owner only)

setPayoutOrder(uint256,address[]).details: Set a custom payout order for a thrift group (admin only).      Can only be called before the group becomes active (i.e., before it is full).

params.payoutOrder: Array containing the addresses in the desired payout sequence

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

params.newTimeThreshold: New threshold for time between withdrawals

upgradeToAndCall(address,bytes).details: Upgrade the implementation of the proxy to `newImplementation`, and subsequently execute the function call encoded in `data`. Calls {_authorizeUpgrade}. Emits an {Upgraded} event.

version().details: Get implementation version for upgrade tracking

canWithdraw().notice: Uses block.timestamp for determining withdrawal windows - this is safe and intendedThe thrift system requires time-based withdrawal restrictions for the savings model

makeContribution(uint256).notice: Convenience contribution  uses the group's configured token and contribution amount. The caller must have approved `contributionAmount` of `tokenAddress` to this contract beforehand. Mirrors the signature expected by existing test suites.

makeContribution(uint256,address,uint256.notice: Standard contribution with explicit token and amount (kept for flexibility)
